intro: Myricaria, commonly known as the sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cupuliferae. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees that thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. They are characterized by their narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often yellow or greenish in color. Myricaria species are often found in sandy or rocky soils, and they play a role in stabilizing desert ecosystems. Some species are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
